thread.title: Hall only Bengals player not probable or better for Bills game
thread.title_full: Hall only Bengals player not probable or better for Bills game

title: Hall only Bengals player not probable or better for Bills game
text:
Hall only Bengals player not probable or better for Bills game 
Updated: Fri, Oct 16 2015, 01:45 PM 
CINCINNATI (Richard Skinner) -- All 53 players on the Bengals active roster practiced on Friday in some capacity for the second straight and only one player is listed as anything worse than probable for playing in Sunday's game in Buffalo. 
Defensive back Leon Hall is listed as questionable for the 1 p.m. game, which can be seen on Local12, and was the only player who wasn't a full participant as he was limited for a second straight day due to a back injury that prevented him from practicing at all on Wednesday. 
Hall, who is used primarily in nickel coverage, left Sunday's 27-24 overtime win against the Seattle Seahawks at some point in the second half, although no official injury update on him was given during the game. He wound up playing only 13 snaps. 
There are six players listed as probable for Sunday's game, and all six were full participants on Friday (injury listed in parentheses): starting cornerback Adam Jones (groin); wide receiver Brandon Tate (illness); wide receiver Marvin Jones (foot); cornerback Dre Kirkpatrick (hip); offensive tackle Andre Smith (elbow) and guard Kevin Zeitler (elbow). 
Check back for the Bills official injury report when it becomes available. 
Photo: Tony Tribble for Local.12 
Follow us on Twitter @Local12 and LIKE us on Facebook for updates! 
To get "The Skinny" on local sports be sure to follow Local12 Digital Sports Columnist/Editor Richard Skinner on Twitter @Local12Skinny and LIKE him on Facebook for updates or email him raskinner@sbgtv.com. Related Stories
